description: From German Rotogravur, derived from the Berlin printing firm Rotogravur Deutsche Tiefdruck Gesellschaft, the name of which is conjectured to be a portmanteau of Rotophot and Deutsche Photogravur.

entries.meaning: A printing process by which the paper is rolled through intaglio cylinders.
A print made by such a method.
A portion of a printed work produced by this method.
examples: On the avenue, Fifth Avenue, the photographers will snap us, And you'll find that you're in the rotogravure.
